text: What are two ways to make an object look metallic using the URP/Lit Shader?

options.text: By using the Specular workflow or the Metallic workflow in a material.
By applying a diffuse map or a metallic map.
By applying a diffuse map and a normal map, or a specular map and a height map.
By increasing smoothness to 100% to create a specular reflection, or removing the diffuse map to eliminate any diffuse reflection.

feedbackCorrect: Unity provides two ways to make objects look metallic. The Specular workflow is the more scientific of the two. The Metallic workflow is simpler, but doesnâ€™t strictly follow the rules of physical light.
feedbackIncorrect: Shaders and materials work together to define all the characteristics of a mesh surface during the rendering process. A material is an asset that works with a shader to define how meshes will be rendered.
